appDesc.message: Discover, share, import, and use the best prompts for ChatGPT & save your chat history locally (formerly ChatGPT History)

archive_files.message: These files are used to restore your prompts & history. Export all includes history, prompts, and settings.

auto_send_note.message: Your prompt will automatically send when you click the continue button

auto_send_prompt.message: Automatically send message when using prompt

chatgpt_plus_user.description: The extension will try to detect this automatically, but it sometimes fails. Don't check this if you're not using ChatGPT plus.

cloud_disclaimer.message: Note: you must be signed in to the same Google account for syncing to work properly.

cloud_note.message: Sync your prompts on the cloud with Google Sheets. Chrome only.

cloud_rearrange.message: To rearrange your prompts with syncing enabled, drag the rows in your linked spreadsheet

default_continue.message: The following is a transcript of a conversation between me and ChatGPT. Use it for context in the rest of the conversation. Be ready to edit and build upon the responses previously given by ChatGPT. Respond "ready!" if you understand the context. Do not respond with anything else. Conversation:

default_continue_message_note.message: This will appear before the transcript of your conversation when you click the "continue" button. Note this only applies to old conversations before the December 15, 2022 update.

description_export.message: These files can be used to transfer your prompts somewhere else & are meant to be human readable.

disable_prompts_on_chatgpt.description: Your prompt templates won't show up on ChatGPT. For use with other Chrome Extensions.

faq_bug_text_part1.message: We're sorry to hear that you've encountered a bug. If you could please raise an issue on our

faq_bug_text_part3.message: , we'll work on resolving the problem as soon as possible. If you're feeling adventurous, you can also open a pull request to fix the bug yourself and be the change you want to see in the world!

faq_data_answer.message: We understand that your data is important to you, and we want to assure you that it is completely under your control. All of your data is stored locally on your device, and we do not claim any ownership over it. Additionally, we do not have access to your data (we do not have servers), as it is stored solely on your device's local storage. If you choose to share a chat, it will be uploaded to a ShareGPT server, but you will still retain the rights to your data. You can export your data at any time in its raw Markdown format, and we are also working on adding more export formats for your convenience.

faq_data_header.message: What do you do with my data?

faq_data_shared_answer.message: Unless you explicitly share that data using the "share link" button, no data leaves your device. It is all stored in local storage, even exports to pdf/png/md.

faq_data_shared_header.message: Is there any other data that is shared?

faq_delete_header.message: Can I delete something I've shared via link?

faq_improve_extension_text_part1.message: We're always looking for ways to improve our extension, and we would love to hear your ideas. Please use the discussions on our

faq_permissions_answer.message: The only permission we require is for our own subreddit, r/ChatGPTPromptGenius, and this is only to help format when you submit prompts to our subreddit. We also insert a button to allow you to quickly import other people’s prompts. We do not run any scripts on any other subreddit, and we do not collect any data from reddit.

faq_permissions_header.message: Why does this extension require reddit permissions?

faq_sharegpt_data.message: Unfortunately, we are using the public servers from ShareGPT to host your shared services. We have no way of accessing that data. We suggest you should not share any sensitive information.

faq_we_text.message: This project is open source and includes many contributors. You can help by opening an issue or pull request if you see something that needs improvement.

help_translate.message: Help translate this into your language or fix auto-translated content.

make_prompts_default_home.message: Make prompts the default home page

mass_delete_note.message: Mass delete your prompts and threads. We recommend exporting first.

no_data.message: No data available for current branch.

placeholder.message: Type a message or type "/" to select a prompt...

prompt_body.message: Prompt content. Use {{}} to denote a variable. Ex: {{name}} is a {{adjective}} {{noun}}

prompt_tags.message: Tags for your prompt. Separate with a comma & no space.

resync_interim.message: This page is for the interim purpose of isolating resyncing while we squash some bugs. Click "Resync All" in the navbar to resync all of your previous conversations with ChatGPT.

use_ctrl_enter_to_save.message: Use ctrl + enter (or ⌘ + enter for mac) to save prompts (instead of enter).

use_visual_editor_on_reddit.message: Use visual text editor on reddit (for sharing prompts)

welcome_history.message: Welcome! This is where your thread history will appear. To start syncing, open ChatGPT.
